thread.title: Boeing lifts full-year outlook as quarterly profit soars 25% | Americas
thread.title_full: Boeing lifts full-year outlook as quarterly profit soars 25% | Americas | BDlive

author: Alwyn Scott and Ankit Ajmera
title: Boeing lifts full-year outlook as quarterly profit soars 25% | Americas
text:
Picture: REUTERS Related articles Airline staff storm meeting on job cuts Treasury keeps tabs on SAA’s use of guarantee China vows to embrace US investors NEW YORK/BENGALURU — Boeing reported a 25% rise in quarterly profit and lifted its financial guidance for the year, as a rise in commercial aircraft deliveries boosted revenue.
The world’s largest aircraft maker notched up its forecast for jet deliveries for the year to between 755 and 760, from 750-755, and said it now expects core earnings of between $7.95 and $8.15 per share, up from $7.70-$7.90 previously.
Core earnings, which exclude some pension and other costs, rose 18% to $2.52 per share in the third quarter from $2.14 a year earlier.
Overall Boeing earned net profit of $1.7bn, or $2.47 per share, for the third quarter, up from $1.36bn, or $1.86 per share, a year earlier.
Revenue rose 9% to $25.85bn.
Commercial aircraft deliveries rose about 7% to 199.
Boeing said the deferred production cost balance for its 787 Dreamliner, a measure of the programme’s progress towards profitability, rose to $28.3bn in the third quarter from $27.7bn in second quarter.
Boeing said it now expects operating cash flow of about $9.5bn for the year, compared with the prior forecast of more than $9bn.
The company also said it expects revenue for the year in the range of $95bn-$97bn, up from $94.5bn-$96.5bn previously.
Reuters
